pageContext.title: Spotify Year in Review 2022
pageContext.content:
![spotify-2022.png](https://media.graphassets.com/XO0rBwvtS7qXqKzpcY3e)

Every year when the Spotify Year in Review is released I'm always a little surprised at what I've been listening to the most all year. I listen to music on Spotify a lot. It's by far my most used paid for service. Because of that you'd think I'd have a better idea of what my artist rankings would be going in - but every single year at least two are surprising. 

This year, it was my #1 and #2 I didn't see coming.

I LOVE Frank Turner and Ryan Adams but I honestly didn't think I listened to them more than anyone else. I can't help but wonder how much of that is Spotify putting their music in their dynamically made playlists. Regardless, I didn't see that one coming.

The Bronx is my favorite band of all time so them being in my top 5 is a constant. Forever.

Amos Lee is a mellow goto for me. My wife and I would play him regularly when cooking dinner or winding down after work. Welcome to my top5, my dude.

And finally Slomosa. Easily my favorite band I listened to for the first time this year (Thanks, Mike!). Their self titled album came out in 2020 but I was late to the party. Better late than ever - they're awesome.

As always, wonderful stuff from Spotify.
